MOSCOW—Owners of mining company Mechel are putting the company at risk of bankruptcy due to poor management and unwillingness to strike a debt deal with banks, the head of largest Russian lender Sberbank said Friday.

Mechel, controlled by the billionaire Igor Zyuzin, has more than $8 billion in outstanding debt, with a major bulk of it provided by Russia’s three largest state-run banks: Sberbank, VTB and Gazprombank.
